text: We're rapidly moving across the water, skimming, towards dark woods on the far shore.
ELIZABETH MARCUS drives her Toyota Celica along this heav wooded road.  She's a young woman, innocent looking, swee and pretty.
The light is fading.  Shadows begin to overtake the land.
She is obviously some place remote.  A sign caught briefl in her headlights says, "CRYSTAL LAKE - 4 MILES".  Elizab swings the car around a barely seen curve in the road.  S pulls up...
Elizabeth parks the Toyota.  She gets out, takes a look a the cabin.
A "FOR RENT" sign hangs, tacked to the porch at an angle. The place looks dark, dirty, uninviting.
She moves to her rear door, opens it and bends in to get over-night bag.  Behind her, the darkness gapes with the ominous threat of violence.
She comes back out of the car and moves to the cabin.  A porch swing, rotted and unusable, BANGS METHODICALLY agai the old wood of the house.  Elizabeth fumbles for the key and drops them.
As she bends down to pick off, the "FOR RENT" sign snaps chain and swings down, missing her neck by inches.
Startled, she rips the sign off and tosses it onto the po with a LOUD BANG.
Elizabeth enters.  The place is damp and dank.  A layer o moldy dust has gathered.  Shadows obscure the corners of room.
Elizabeth put down her bag and gropes the wall for a swit She finds one.  Flips it.  The light turns on for a few b moments...then sputters and goes out.
Shit...
She turns and goes back outside.
Elizabeth walks slowly around the cabin, towards a decrep old woodshed at the edge of a dark, unfriendly woods.  Sh slowly opens the door...a mossy ladder rests against the wall.
Elizabeth enters and walks towards the ladder.  Suddenly, woodshed door BANGS CLOSED.  Elizabeth SHRIEKS then, scrabbling at the door, flings it open and rushes outside with the ladder.
There is a RUSTLE off among the trees.  She hesitates aga Footsteps on dry leaves?  Just a gust of wind off the lak
With a last look over her shoulder, she drags the ladder towards the cabin and enters.

Elizabeth comes back in with the ladder.  She picks up he bag, removes a four pack of bulbs and, climbing on the ladder, replaces the bulb in the living room.  The light comes on...but it's scant illumination against the dark n
Suddenly, her foot slips on the slimy step of the ladder she drops the old bulb, which SHATTERS LOUDLY on the floo

Grimacing, Elizabeth climbs down the ladder and quickly sweeps up the broken glass.  Having done that, she shuts front door all the way, then puts her bag on the bed and opens it.  She takes out a few pairs of jeans and some sh and moves to the standing wardrobe.
We know that she will open the doors of that wardrobe and come face to face with her death.
She opens the wardrobe.
Nothing...just a moth.
She puts her clothes away.  The sound of a branch SCRAPIN against the side of the cabin adds to the tension.  Now s turns...
...there is no one waiting there in the doorway. Elizabeth yawns, stretches and walks up the stairwell to second floor landing, which leads into a pitch black hall

She moves down the hallway, then enters the bathroom and turns on the light.  Crossing to the bathtub, she bends d and turns on the hot water.  It comes spitting out, brack and brown at first, then finally clear.
She stays, bent over the tub, letting the dirty water run down the drain.  Then she puts the plug in, filling the t for a bath.  As it fills, she undresses down to the her T-shirt and underwear.
She looks over to discover that the medicine cabinet door open.  She crosses to it and closes it.
This has got to be the one.  She will close that door and there, reflected in the mirror will be...
...nothing, just the dim illumination of the bathroom lig
She bends down to test the temperature of the tub water. It's good.
She removes her underwear and t-shirt, then puts one foot the water, testing it, then eases into the comforting war
The light in the bathroom sputters and then burns out.
Elizabeth SIGHS, resigned, then continues climbing into t tub when -- WHAM!
The front door blows open, banging into the wall.
Elizabeth turns, startled.  She grabs her towel (brushing her makeup bag) and, wrapping the towel around her, walks slowly down the dark hallway onto the landing.
From downstairs, she HEARS A NOISE.
Bending precariously far out over the landing, she looks onto the first floor.
Nothing but the stirring of leaves, blowing into the cabi through the open doorway.
as a cool breeze from the doorway makes her shiver.  Slow she moves towards the stairs when we HEAR THAT SOUND AGAI from downstairs.  What the hell is it?  Once again she le far out over the landing.
Still nothing.  Leaves.  The WHINE OF THE WIND.
looking -- something must have made that noise.  Then, suddenly, from the perfect darkness behind her, JASON VOORHEES steps out, hockey mask in place, machete sharp a ready.
Elizabeth stands back up, OBSCURING JASON FROM VIEW.
feeling that something is definitely not right...in fact, something is really, really wrong.  With a panicked expression, she turns around to look behind her.
Nothing.  Darkness.  Jason is gone.
Relaxing -- everything's okay.  She turns towards the sta and right into Jason, who raises his machete high.
With a SCREAM, she leaps backwards as Jason swings, flyin through the rotted wood of the railing and crashing down the first floor.
yanking his machete from the wooden bolster on the railin
looking down at her towel.  It's sliced through -- a thin line of blood crossing her stomach in a diagonal.  She ru
Elizabeth leaps from the porch, over an overrun flowerbed onto the hood of her car.  She quickly looks behind her.
to see Jason striding through the front door of the the cabin, coming for her.

as she skids all the way across the hood of the car onto far side, then runs through the trees and brush in front the house -- her feet bare, her eyes panicked.  The branc seem to claw at her, tearing, scratching...
quickly gaining.  God, he moves fast!  Elizabeth turns, s us and SCREAMS.
turning back to face forward when -- WHACK!  She's clippe a tree and knocked to the ground.  She scrambles up and l around.
Jason is nowhere to be seen.
Elizabeth moves slowly now, turning around, her breathing quick and panicked.  Where is he?!  Is he toying with her She turns and Jason leaps in front of her, machete raised
Suddenly, Elizabeth reaches into the cleavage at the fron her towel and pulls out a small pistol.
Eat me, you bastard!
She fires one shot directly into Jason's forehead, knocki him back at step, then turns and bolts towards --
She runs into this clearing then turns to see Jason rapid coming after her, striding out into the open, raising his machete ready to deliver the lethal blow when, suddenly,

head_text.subj: INTENSE BRIGHT LIGHTS SNAP ON AROUND THE CLEARING

text: stunning Jason for a moment.  The girl disappears into th treeline as
cracks out from the darkness.  There are FBI AGENTS hidde behind every tree, bush and rock...and now, they are all firing on Jason at once.
Jason jerks as the bullets tear into his body.
Then there is a moment...the FBI agents watching...waitin for Jason to fall.
But he doesn't fall.  He stands there.  His head turning slowly, searching the darkness for his next kill.  Sudden from out of the darkness we hear:
Incoming!
We hear a muffled SHOOMP! sound, then a familiar WHISTLIN a mortar shell descends on Jason in the middle of the clearing.
The grenade lands right at Jason's feet.
An anxious beat...then...
We watch as Jason is blown, irrevocably, limb from limb.
spinning slowly in the air in SLO-MO.  An arm, something unrecognizable, his head still in the hockey mask, then, finally
spinning through the air to finally land, with a WET PLOP the field.  It beats once, then once more...then stops.

A moment of silence...then the rest of the FBI agents eme from their hiding places.  There is an eerie after-the-ba silence to the scene.  Jason's crimes have been so heinou that even in death, proximity to his mangled remains seem render a somber atmosphere.

AGENT ABERNATHY makes his way through his quiet, somehow stunned men, and over to Elizabeth.  He is clearly the ma charge -- his suit alone says that and his demeanor backs Elizabeth stands and faces him.  It is a strange tableau. bright lights, the smoke in the air, the nearly naked wom facing the man in the suit.
Agent Abernathy offers his hand.
Good job, Agent Marcus.
(shaking his hand) Thank you, sir.

A T.V. Camera is thrust into Abernathy's face.  The MEDIA apparently caught wind of this event.  REPORTERS scream f "Agent Abernathy...your comments..."  "What was your firs thought when..."  Abernathy smiles and puts on his best "media" face.
Ladies and Gentlemen, please... please...
The CROWD QUIETS.
(continuing) It is my pleasure to announce that Jason Voorhees is finally and irrevocably...dead.

sitting some distance away on the rise of a hill.  His weathered face shows a healthy contempt for this somewhat premature celebration.  He plugs a twisty, homegrown ciga into the corner of his mouth, light a match off the beard stubble on his chin, then fires up the cigar -- a glowing coal in the darkness.  His hawk's eyes stare at something with ferocious intent...
Laying on the ground in the clearing, not beating...but intact.
Where we see the heart on a rolling metal surgical table.
A CORONER, a big man in his 30's, as he rolls the cart up a security checkpoint manned by TWO FBI AGENTS.  The coro hands his I.D. to FBI AGENT 1, then lifts his arms as FBI AGENT 2 pats him down.
Okay, sir.
The two sliding doors in front of the coroner slide open he wheels the metal surgical cart inside, the door closin behind him.
The Coroner is in the middle of his autopsy.  He talks in a microphone as he works, taking the dismembered parts of Jason from a body bag.
We have a large male caucasian...age unknown...
He begins inspecting various organs, weighs them, takes samples.  He works methodically, making verbal notes as h works.
(continuing) No indication of cirrhosis.
as the coroner inspects it.
The heart is nearly twice the size of a normal heart.  Malformed...
He's about to lift the heart when...the heart beats!
The coroner stops.  He didn't see that.
(trying to keep his composure) It appears to be filled with a black, viscous fluid...frankly, I don't know what the hell it is.  It's not blood.
The heart beats again! The coroner stares, shocked, transfixed.
The heart undulates now as it beats...it is a hypnotic, throbbing pulse.  Something that has to be stared at. Something that awakens deep, impossible cravings.
It draws the coroner towards it, his eyes glassy, transfi by what he sees.
It beats faster, undulating, a gaping, kneading maw...
The coroner stares, then reaches down and takes the now furiously beating heart in his hands.
He looks at it for a frighteningly long beat.  He brings closer to his face.  He would appear to be studying it... trying to understand what in God's name this thing is...
And then he suddenly smiles, raises the monstrous organ t his lips...
...and eats the heart of Jason Voorhees!
When he finishes the heart, he stands for a moment, not moving.  Then, suddenly, his throat bulges and he begins SCREAM A HORRIBLE SCREAM and, as he SCREAMS we
Dead silence.  Whatever is going on in that room cannot b heard through the airtight doors.
The CORONER'S ASSISTANT walks up, carrying dinner.  The t FBI MEN stop him.
I.D.
You just saw me come out of there.
I.D. please.
Annoyed, fumbling, the assistant takes out his I.D.
The assistant walks in to see the Coroner doubled over.
Hey, what's the matter.
The Coroner straightens, then turns to the assistant.  Hi mouth is smeared with black liquid of the heart.
(continuing) You ate already?  I was only gone ten minutes.
The assistant tosses the food on the counter as the Coron takes
from off the table and walks over to him.
The Coroner holds the dissecting probe up to the Assistan face.
(continuing) Yes.  That's a probe.
Suddenly, using his other hand, the Coroner
up through the soft flesh under the Assistant's jaw hooki his finger through the Assistant's mouth and jerking the assistant's head down to

head_text.subj: SMASH INTO THE METAL EXAMINING TABLE

text: Then, the Coroner takes the dissecting probe and drives i into the back of the Assistant's skull.  The Assistant spasms...then goes still.
The Coroner turns and walks to the door, passing by a mir
to see the reflection.  It is not the coroner walking by...it's

head_text.subj: JASON VOORHEES, HOCKEY MASK IN PLACE

text: The Coroner/Jason strides out of the doors and walks past FBI men.
So that's the verdict -- is Jason gonna be getting up and walking around any time soon?
The Coroner/Jason stops and slowly turns back to the two smiling FBI men -- there will be doom here very soon.
Over this we hear:
Tonight, on American Casefile...
WHOOSHING SFX as the words "American Casefile" are stampe red across the screen.  Behind them, a graphic of Jason's hockey mask ZOOMS UP.
Jason Voorhees -- dead...or deadly?
Photos of the two FBI men from the morgue, dead and blood as well as photos of the dead assistant coroner.

These dramatic photos were taken in the aftermath of the autopsy of Jason Voorhees, mere hours after his death at the hands of Federal Forces.  The facts:  Two security men -- dead.  A Coroner -- dead.  Another Coroner -- missing.  Are these men victims  of a serial killer only believed to be deceased?  Many say yes.
ROBERT CAMPBELL.  In his early 30's, he's got T.V. good looks.  He speaks in the overly serious "journalese" of tabloid television.

I'm Robert Campbell.  Tonight, on American Casefile, we'll talk, via satellite, to Mr. Creighton Duke -- the bounty hunter responsible for the capture of six of this country's most reviled serial killers/
to include Duke, playing idly with a small dagger.
We recognize him as the man who we saw watching Jason die It's difficult to say how old he is -- it's his life that weathered him, not his years.
Mr. Duke, how can you claim that Jason Voorhees is not truly dead?
How many times has Jason been reported killed before, Mr. Campbell?
Eight times.
Eight times.  They've burned him, dipped him in nuclear waste --
-- But this time they bombed him and then cremated the body.

They coulda danced a jig on it an' fed it to goats -- don't matter.  Ya' can't kill Jason by gettin' rid of his body.  He'll come back the way he always do, to drag the kiddies into the darkness and crush their little skulls -- maybe even your skull, Mr. Campbell.
Campbell laughs and smiles winningly.
Well, let's hope not!
Yeah, that'd be a big shame...
A look between the two of them.
In the media, you've frequently been described as "salty" --

-- look, just shut up.  Let's cut through the shit.  You asked me here because you want me to catch and kill Jason Voorhees for ya'.  I'll do it, but it won't be easy...and it won't be cheap.  One hundred grand, non- negotiable.
I understand.  However, our audience should be aware that you only charged forty thousand dollars to catch the Idaho skin stretcher.
Skin stretcher was human.
Campbell takes a moment to make sure that isn't lost on h audience.  Duke leans in close.

(continuing) Let's get one thing straight, Mr. Campbell.  This isn't your garden variety serial killer -- there's only one way to put and end ta' put an' end to Jason Voorhees for all time and I'm the only one that knows the way.  If you want him dead truly dead -- my fee is one hundred grand. You know where to find me.
Duke stands.
Mr. Duke tonight I'm prepared to offer you your sum of one hundred thousand dollars, payable only after you provide American Casefile with incontrovertible proof of --
-- yeah, yeah, yeah.  You just have your hundred grand ready.  For that you get the machete...the mask...the whole damn thing.
The TV suddenly SNAPS OFF.

to see DIANA KIMBLE, leaning back after having just shut off. Sexy, in her early 40's, Diana is a waitress here in "Joey B's Diner".  Many people might be disturbed by the notion that Jason Voorhees is still alive, but for Diana...this means something much more.
Hey!  Lady Di!
Diana whirls around to see JOEY B. -- the frightening, no bullshit owner of the diner.  She's a big woman with a bi attitude.
I'm sorry to cut into your TV time, but there's a few customers out here who'd like to eat sometime this fuckin' month.

"Joey B's Diner" may not be the last place in the world y want to eat, but it's at least the second to last.  A cou of hockey masks hang from the ceiling and a banner procla "JASON IS DEAD -- 2 FOR 1 BURGER SALE!" hangs on the far
Diana walks out and looks at this with an amused dismay.
This is truly sick.
Tell me about it.
That comes from VICKI, the other waitress in the diner. Early 20's, she's cute and she's tough.  She moves off as Joey B. steps up.
No, this is not sick, Diana, this is business.  People are gonna come to see Jason's hometown and they're gonna come with appetites.
SHELBY, Joey B.'s husband and cook, leans out the serving window.
Di -- food's up!
Thanks, Shelby.
Besides him, WARD, Shelby and Joey B.'s early 20's son, sticks his head out as well.
Ma -- you seriously want me to cut these like this?
He holds up a hamburger patty cut into the shape of a hoc mask -- oval with punched out eyeholes.
Yes I do!
They look stupid...
Well, that's your dumbass fault -- they're supposed to look like hockey masks!  Now watch.
Joey B. quickly cuts a fresh hamburger patty into the appropriate shape, then balls up the cut-away meat and ho it up in front of Ward.
This makes a whole new patty...hence the 2 for 1 burger sale.
My God, I love this woman.
They kiss.
You guys make me sick.
They break apart.  Shelby turns to Diana.
Table 3, Di.

We follow Diana as she picks up several plates and walks towards a table, passing by STEVEN FREEMAN who sits at th counter next to his friend RANDY -- a young cop in unifor Steven, early 20's and good-looking, turns to Diana -- wh he's about to say is difficult for him but he tries to ma it seem casual.
Diana -- you heard from Jessica lately?
Yes.
She sets a plate down in front of him and continues walki Randy turns to Steven with a wry smile.
Allright, you're gettin' somewhere...
We follow Diana to the table where JOSH (40's) and SHERIF LANDIS sit.  Diana gives everyone their food as Randy wal over and sits down with them.
(to Josh) Burger, side of fries. (to Randy) Double burger, side of rings. (to Sheriff) Meatloaf, side of me.
And she leans forward and plants a kiss on his lips.  Jos smiles.
Where the hell was that on the menu? I'd have ordered a couple.
(mock threat) You keep movin' in on my woman and I might have to take you out back and shoot you.
Yeah, I've seen you shoot...
They all smile.  It's a nice moment, until:
I don't know... (baiting him) ...I think you two should just go ahead and get married.
The Sheriff turns to him.
I'm sorry, son, I'm going' a little deaf in my old age...what did you say again?
He stares at Randy fixedly.
I said I think I'll just eat my food over by Steven and shut the hell up.
(to Josh) That's exactly what I thought he said.
Randy smiles and walks over to Steven as the Sheriff turn Diana and affectionately rubs her back.
Everything going okay?
It's going.
Legs giving you trouble?
Not so bad, today.
The Sheriff watches Randy sit back beside Steven.  Steven glances over, catches the Sheriff's eye, then quickly tur away.
Steven buggin' you?
Do you have to ask?
Jesus, he's relentless.
Let me talk to him, Diana.  I just need three minutes with him.
(warningly) Ed...
Okay. (a beat) So how is Jessica?  You talked to her lately?
Yeah, she's good, considering. That kid just takes everything in stride.
(mumbling into food) Wonder where she got that from...
Diana smiles at him.
I gotta get back to work.
Okay, I'll call you later.
She gives him a quick kiss, then walks off. Josh watches go, then fixes the Sheriff with a knowing stare.
Don't say it...
Josh grins.  He starts HUMMING THE WEDDING BELL MARCH.
(continuing) How about this -- I'll make you a deal...I'll marry Diana when you quit banging Edna and concentrate on your wife.
(shakes his head) Poor, lonely Diana...
as she arrives at another table.  The customer's face is hidden by a menu.
What can I get ya'?
I'll take a Voorhees burger and a side of Jason Fingers.
The man lowers the menu.  It's Duke.  He smiles.  Diana, recognizing him, takes a step back.  She recovers quickly
Anything else?
Yes.
Duke extends his hand.
(continuing) Creighton Duke.
Hesitantly, Diana shakes his hand.
I know who you are.
I need to talk to you.
I'm kind of busy right now...
I'm going to kill Jason Voorhees -- and I need you to help me.
Jason Voorhees is dead.
You know he's not...and he's coming for you.
You food'll be right out.
She turns to go.
I'll give you ten thousand dollars.
That stops her.  She turns back.
No, I --
Twenty.
Look --
Thirty.  Name your price.  Everyone has a price, what's yours?
Look, I don't want your money!
Then maybe I should offer it to your daughter...
Diana does not, at any level, like Jessica being brought the conversation.  She leans in close.
What do you want?
You know what I want.  You know why I need you.
You need to leave.
I know everything about you, Diana.
That's it, we're done.
She turns to go.
I know who you really are!
This stops her in her tracks.  Suddenly, we hear:
What's the problem here?
N...nothing.
I was just making your girlfriend there a little proposition...she's thinking it over.  Right, luv?
The Sheriff steps forward.
Maybe you should be moving on.
Maybe you should mind your own business.
Get up!
Why don't you blow me, Chief. (a beat) After your girlfriend gets through.
The Sheriff thinks a second -- then, suddenly, he swings Duke.
With surprising speed, Duke's hand darts up, catching the Sheriff's fist.  But, with equally surprising speed, Land brings his gun up under the man's chin.
You're talking about my lady.
She's your lady only cause she ain't had a taste of the Duke yet.
Goddamnit!
He grabs Duke, pulling him up from the table.
Careful, Chief.  I don't think you know who I am.
I know who you are and the last thing we need around here is some freak show "bounty hunter" making trouble. I want you outta town and I want you outta town now!
That's very colorful, chief.
(to Randy) Take him to my car.  I'll be out in a minute.
Let's go.
He's comin' for you, Diana...and your daughter.  Lock your doors.
Randy takes Duke away.  The Sheriff turns to Diana, a lit proud, a little manly.
I'm sorry if he upset you...
Diana angrily turns to him.
I don't need you to fight my battle. I don't need any part-time protection.
Saying that, she walks off.  The Sheriff glances around a the people in the diner then, a little cowed, goes outsid
as she walks up to the counter where Steven sits.
He seem to think Jason's... (in Duke's accent) ...comin' fer ya'?
He smiles.  She doesn't.  Vicki walks up.
You okay?
Diana nods.
(continuing) Okay.
Vicki moves off.  When she does, Diana turns to Steven.
Steven, I need to talk to you. There's something you don't know about Jessica, something you should know.  She was going to tell you herself but...
Diana looks up and stares out the window.
One of Joey B's hockey mask spins slowly in her field of vision, but instead of looking cheesy...it now seems scary...foreboding.  Diana turns back to Steven.
...but there just may not be enough time.  If you still care about her, if you still want to try to make things better between you two...we should talk.
So let's talk.
No.  Not here.  Come by my house tonight at eleven.  Don't be late.
As Steven looks at her worried face, we
Diana comes out the back door of the diner, taking the garbage out.
slowly moving in on her, stalking.  There shadows, the da gaps of night and woods between her and the trash...we ju know that she is going to die.
as Diana approaches it.  She flings it open with a LOUD B then dumps the trash in.  We stay close...sure she is goi into that dumpster with her trash...
But no...she finishes and turns...
...Right into Josh!
Jesus!
Sorry, Di.  I was just going to my car.  I didn't mean to frighten you...
It's...It's all right.
Josh takes the trash can from her...carries it back towar the diner.
Listen...don't you worry about Ed. He'll come around.  He's too good a Sheriff to let you give him the slip.
I'm just too old for going steady, Josh.
So's he and he knows it.
They've reached the diner.  He opens the door for her.
(continuing) Everything'll work out.  Trust me on that.
Okay.
Good night, beautiful.
'Night, Josh.
She gives him a quick hug, then closes the diner door, go back inside to clean up.
Josh steps off the porch and around back to the parking l
following him, moving in, closer...
EDNA steps out of her car as Josh approaches.  She's an attractive woman around Josh's age.  He smiles and moves kiss her.  She stops him.
Not here.
She looks around nervously.
(continuing) Sorry I'm late.
Bill didn't go bowling at the regular time?
The League changed the damn time...but we've still got 'til ten- thirty.  Hop in.
Josh smiles and hurries to the passenger side of the car Edna climbs back in behind the wheel.
Suddenly rushing towards the car, smashing into the drive door, slamming it shut with tremendous force just as Edna head is lowered to enter.
She is dead.
Turns to Josh who stands frozen in absolute terror.
as we --
BLACK, then slowly

Strapped on a metal table.  Straps across his body.  Even strap to hold his head firmly in place.  FIRELIGHT dances across his apparently nude body and his terror-stricken e His terror grows as a shadow leans in to cover his face.

As he looks down at Josh.  It is the coroner we see, but eyes are those black empty pools of Jason's evil.  Many l sores cover the man's face. Even as we watch, another seems to push its way forth fro the skin.  Clearly, they weaken the man.  He sways slight Catches his balance... and raises something into view.  A STRANGER RAZOR.

As he begins to whimper.  The man lowers the razor toward his face.  The blade glints in the firelight as the Coroner/Jason brings it down, closer... closer... until i sharp edge touches Josh's skin.  Then, suddenly,
The man begins to give Josh a shave!
The SCRAPE of the razor is loud against Josh's unlathered moustache.
Now the cornoner/Jason moves the blade across Josh's Adam apple... carefully, expertly.
When the man is finished, there is a long, uncertain beat then his hands bring a hot towel into view.
As the towel is laid over his face.
Over which we hear the STRANGLED SOUNDS of the Coroner/Ja breathing -- what the hell is he doing?  After a long mom the towel is lifted and, still in
We see the coroner/Jason lean in, opening his mouth wide, until his face fills the screen.
A beat, then Josh SCREAMS a horrible SCREAM as we

There is a dark and evil aura to the house, but it is not Victorian haunted house of some storybook tale of ghosts. a place built as a summer home in the forties... abandone years ago... it looks now as if it is dissolving slowly b into the small, encroaching corner of the lake behind it into the woods around it.

But the sense of evil doesn't come from the rot or the decay... those are just symptoms. The sense of evil comes from the core of darkness that we feel in every gaping window.  In every shadow.  In the da shadows of the trees and the darker waters of the lake.
As Josh continues to SCREAM, we
Steven and Randy sit by the counter, Vicki stands beside and we can see Ward back in the kitchen, cooking up some
(to Vicki) What do you mean you've never made a prank call?
Never.
You mean never as in really never, or never as in it was just so stupid you don't want to tell us about it?
I mean really never.
I'm sorry to hear that.  A famous man once said -- there is no worse regret then a temptation resisted.
A beat.
Jesus, Steven, that's...that's really lovely.
I mean, how can you go through life without never having made a prank call?
Hell, when Steven was a kid, he was like, having strippers delivered to church Bingos and shit.
That's disgusting.
Disgusting?  Bingo night was sold out for six months after that!  They raised enough money to build a day care center.
It was a community service.
Absolutely.  The church even sent me an autographed picture of God. (yelling to the back) Ward!
(shouting from back) Yeah!
You ever make a prank call?
I called an adoption agency once when I was like nine or something and I told them I wanted to trade my mom in for a box of Lincoln Logs.
Suddenly, a wet sponge comes flying in from offscreen and hits Ward in the face.
Why don't you shut the fuck up and cook those burgers?!
I really wanted those fuckin' Logs.
As he gets up and walks over to the pay phone in the dine
What are you doing?
Showing Vicki what she missed out on by being such a dull kid.  Now, the first thing you need in making a prank call is, of course, a phone. (holds up the phone) This one, for instance.
Steven, c'mon, we're not thirteen...
Next, you dial a number.
Really, Steven, I don't want you to do this...
Steven dials a number.
The receiver to see Steven click it off out of view of th others.
...and it's now ringing...ringing... and -- Hello? Anthony's Pizzeria? Yeah, this is officer Randy Parker over at the station.

On the mirror over the mantle.  In the reflection she see not Josh, but Jason Voorhees, mask in place.

Josh/Jason isn't there.

...Josh/Jason leaps out at her, grabs her and flings her to the floor.

Steven is in this dismal interrogation room.  He's tired, frightened, angry.  We don't know how long he's been here but it's clearly been a long time.  SHERIFF and Steven's friend, Randy, are in the room with him.
How many times do you want to hear this?
Until I hear the truth.
I've told you the truth.

The truth?  That Josh, a man I've trusted with my own life on more than one occasion -- let me see if I've got the order right here -- tried to rape Diana...got the back of his head blown off...took a poker through the gut...fell through a plate glass window and then magically disappeared into the night.
I know what it sounds like.
